::Battera::

She smiled. "I can't argue there."  She kissed his cheek,"Don't 
worry. Everything will be ok."  She really had no idea how things 
were going to end up. but she was at lest willing to try.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "David Torrey" <Dachande85@m...> wrote:
> ::CyberShark::
> 
>     He was down right against letting anything happen to Battera, 
but she seemed adamant. "Alright, I'll watch you. But at the first 
sign of anything going wrong I'm getting you back."
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: logomorph@h... 
>   To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
>   Sent: Sunday, October 15, 2000 4:41 PM
>   Subject: Re: I'm back
> 
> 
>   :: Battera::
> 
>   She gave a small himt of a smile.  She wanted to go back home as 
much 
>   as Vulois did.  She looked at him, "Ah,  We need to find a safe 
place 
>   to stay while we do this.  Uh, we can use the cave. So far as I 
know, 
>   we are the only ones that know about this cave."  She thought 
about 
>   the cord in her shoulder.  It would serve as a link connection, 
but 
>   she hoped her programs would be able to stand up to Vulois.  If 
his 
>   anti-tamper programs were too strong, she wouldn't be able to get 
>   in.  She looked at Cybershark and smiled,"Well, I guess then you 
get 
>   first watch huh?" she tilted her head slighty and gave him  a 
warm 
>   smile. She took a step forward and kissed his cheek." Thank you."
>   She then walked into the cave. She smiled and looked around,"You 
>   know, a few curtains, a little paint, a few more windows, and 
this 
>   place would be down right cozzy." she said with a chuckle.
> 
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, minime_316@h... wrote:
>   > 
>   > Vulois
>   > 
>   > Vulois' face lit up with a smile.
>   > 
>   > "I would do anything to get back to Cybertron. It's better than 
>   > living here." He looked to Cybershark, "Are you up to it?"
>   > 
>   
______________________________________________________________________
>   > Starscream
>   > 
>   > Starscream found Inferno and another bot talking. He decided to 
>   stay 
>   > above them until Drillbit arrived. No sense in going two on 
one. 
>   > Maybe they could take them both back.
> 
> 
>         eGroups Sponsor
